newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Eletrobras to invest 2.5 bln reais.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Eletrobras to invest 2.5 bln reais.

text.p: Brazilian state power holding Eletrobras said it plans to invest 2.5 billion reais in 1997, up 56 percent from last year, to complete nuclear and hydroeletric plants and expand its transmission network.
A company spokeswoman said 620 million reais of the total investment plan would be invested to compelete the construction of Angra II nuclear plant.
Some 200 million reais will be invested in Xingo and Corumba I hydroelectric plants to complete their construction, she said.
She would not disclose further details on the company's investment plan.
